priority_description: Low priority - Nice-to-have improvements and optimizations

issues.title: [P3] Optimize Database Query Performance with Strategic Indexing
issues.body:
## Problem

Current database queries could be optimized with additional strategic indexes on commonly filtered columns.

## Impact

- **Performance**: Faster queries for user/organization lookups
- **Scalability**: Better handling of larger datasets

## Proposed Solution

- Add indexes on frequently filtered columns: `(organization_id, status)`, `(user_id, created_at)`
- Profile queries and identify slow operations
- Document index strategy

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Identify slow queries via EXPLAIN ANALYZE
- [ ] Create migration for new indexes
- [ ] Query performance improved by 20%+
- [ ] Database documentation updated

**Estimated Effort**: 6 hours
**Priority**: P3 - Nice-to-have optimization
**Source**: Code Review 2026-02-02

issues.title: [P3] Add Comprehensive API Response Time Monitoring
issues.body:
## Problem

No built-in monitoring of API endpoint response times to identify performance bottlenecks.

## Impact

- **Visibility**: Better understanding of endpoint performance
- **Optimization**: Identify slow endpoints for optimization

## Proposed Solution

- Add middleware to measure request/response times
- Log metrics with endpoint name and status code
- Create performance baselines for endpoints

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Middleware measures response times
- [ ] Metrics logged to stdout with endpoint info
- [ ] Slow endpoint alerts documented
- [ ] Documentation updated

**Estimated Effort**: 4 hours
**Priority**: P3 - Observability improvement
**Source**: Code Review 2026-02-02

issues.title: [P3] Enhance Frontend Build Pipeline with Asset Optimization
issues.body:
## Problem

Frontend build process could be optimized for smaller bundle sizes and faster load times.

## Impact

- **User Experience**: Faster page loads
- **Performance**: Reduced bandwidth usage
- **SEO**: Better core web vitals

## Proposed Solution

- Configure image optimization (WebP format)
- Set up code splitting for route bundles
- Add minification configuration
- Document build optimization strategy

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Bundle size reduced by 15%+
- [ ] Images optimized to WebP format
- [ ] Code splitting implemented for routes
- [ ] Load time metrics documented

**Estimated Effort**: 5 hours
**Priority**: P3 - Performance optimization
**Source**: Code Review 2026-02-02

issues.title: [P3] Implement Error Tracking and Reporting Dashboard
issues.body:
## Problem

No centralized error tracking or reporting for backend and frontend errors.

## Impact

- **Reliability**: Better understanding of system issues
- **Developer Experience**: Easier debugging in production

## Proposed Solution

- Integrate error tracking service (e.g., Sentry)
- Set up error reporting from both backend and frontend
- Create dashboard for error monitoring
- Document error reporting process

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Error tracking service configured
- [ ] Backend errors captured and reported
- [ ] Frontend errors captured and reported
- [ ] Dashboard accessible to developers
- [ ] Documentation updated

**Estimated Effort**: 8 hours
**Priority**: P3 - Nice-to-have improvement
**Source**: Code Review 2026-02-02

issues.title: [P3] Create Interactive API Playground for Developers
issues.body:
## Problem

While Swagger docs exist, developers lack an interactive playground to test API endpoints without writing code.

## Impact

- **Developer Experience**: Easier API exploration
- **Onboarding**: Faster learning curve for new developers

## Proposed Solution

- Set up API playground tool (e.g., Postman collection)
- Create pre-configured request examples
- Add authentication flow examples
- Document common use cases

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Interactive playground created
- [ ] All endpoints documented with examples
- [ ] Authentication flow demonstrated
- [ ] Shared with development team

**Estimated Effort**: 6 hours
**Priority**: P3 - Developer experience
**Source**: Code Review 2026-02-02
